title: Question about location
content:
Hi ! J'utilise firefox depuis très longtemps sans me rendre compte qu'il connaissait ma position, et n'ai pas de problème avec ça. C'est quand j'ai voulu lui dire que j'habitais aux États-Unis pour changer la langue et le type de résultats (correspondant à ce dont j'ai besoin, mes études et recherches) que je me suis retrouvé coincé ; il ne m'affichait que mon adresse, toujours des résultats en français et aucun résultat pertinent malgré ma langue anglaise. Que faire ?

Merci par avance, Jacques.
creator: jackduedal

title: Synced Tabs sidebar only showing two most recent devices, had four a day ago
content:
Hi, I had an unstabled system for a few months, that required repeated Windows reinstalls. FINALLY tracked down the issue, and now I'm trying to recover all those old tabs. I was making SOME progress, with my last two installs as well as two devices I'm currently using showing and me opening synced tabs laboriously one at a time, over and over, so I could eventually filter through all the doubles and triples and quadruples of tabs that were opened over the last few months. But starting today or yesterday, the Synced Tabs sidebar is no longer showing those last two installs, only my current two, even though those last two - and many others - are still showing in my Connected Devices. Did I reach some auto-cutoff date for Sync storing them? Or does it still have them and I just need to change a setting somewhere?

Thanks for any help you can give, and I DO have a tab backup system, it's just... imperfect. Still working the kinks out of it, so I was hoping to use old Synced tabs to fill in the gaps.
creator: foofmoonshot

title: youtube does not automatically play the next video in the playlist when its loaded
content:
When a playlist is loaded and played on YouTube, the next video in the playlist should automatically start playing once the current video reaches its end. This feature is commonly known as autoplay. However, I couldn't get it to work consistently. When the current video is finished, next video is loaded normally but where it should automatically play it doesn't.

I have tried below to address this issue:

  • Autoplay next video works in safe mode.
  • "allow audio and video" in autoplay permissions in https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/block-autoplay doesn't help
  • I have also set media.block-autoplay-until-in-foreground preference to false in about:config but didn't help
  • I have tried uninstalling all extensions and it didn't help
  • Tried logging out of youtube, but this didn't seem to help with the issue.
  • Tried "Clear startup cache" in "more troubleshooting information" menu, didn't help
  • Tried "Refresh Firefox" which didn't help

Thank you.
creator: choijaeho

title: The page isn’t redirecting properly NS_ERROR_REDIRECT_LOOP
content:
It seems that this problem is common in firefox community. So first of all I basically tried all default troubleshooting steps such as dealing with cookies (turning off, tuning on, exceptions), cleaning data, cleaning cache, security settings, etc etc, even though I am on freshly installed firefox.

So lets see now, problem is with https://vk.com/ website. It works until processing my login info. After I enter necessary credentials, it reloads and just produces infamous error. Network monitor displays loop of login.vk.com domain migrating cookies to login.vk.ru which restores them and then finally trying to open actual account php page starts the loop anew. Well until NS_ERROR_REDIRECT_LOOP stops this shamelessness. Resetting all browser data back, just enables me to enter my credentials again and the same process starts again. I can access this website from the same network from different browsers from different devices and operating systems.

Currently I encounter this problem on recently installed Arch linux, with basically dwm and firefox, and since I had very rough time with how unpredictable this system were so far, I don't know how much it is browser issue, so I think I should mention it.

Thank you in advance.
creator: bigtriks

title: Random glitchy blocks keep appearing/disappearing on every website
content:
This issue started a couple of weeks ago. Whenever I move my mouse, very glitchy blocks sometimes appear on the site I'm using. Their behavior is very different, some blocks stay in a static position for a while, and no amount of moving the cursor changes that. Other blocks disappear as soon as I move the cursor or scroll up or down. The color of the blocks often matches the website background, but sometimes they are just white (this often happens when I highlight text, making it impossible to see) or black. (I really wish I could send a video to really show the behavior).

On some websites, there are no issues (like mozilla.org) while on others the website basically becomes unusable (gmail.com, my uni's website as seen in the pictures).

I really hope someone can help me, I reeeally don't want to switch to Chrome.

My system: ACER Spin 5 SP513-55N77LC Windows 11 Intel Core i7, 16 GB RAM Firefox version: 118.0.2 (64-bit)

What I've tried: deleting all add-ons restart computer several times un- and reinstalling firefox scan for viruses using another browser (no issues there)

title: legördülő menü nem működik
content: Legördülő menü esetén a menü kiválasztásakor nem érzékeli a menüt, hanem az alatta lévő funkciók működnek (ami a menü alatt van). Ez a firefox indításakor többnyire működik, de később nem. Pl. https://www.idokep.hu/idojaras weblapon a "Térképek" menün áll az egér, akkor megjelenik alatta a többi menü. Kiválasztva bármelyiket, nem a kért funkció hajtódik végre, hanem a legördült menü alatti (ha van). Ha ez a hiba előfordul,akkor az következetesen továbbra is hibásan működik. rendszer: OpenSUSE Leap 15.3 firefox: 115.3.1esr (64 bites) opensuse distro-ból updatelve.
